intro: Mouroucoa setosa, commonly known as the hairy mouroucoa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom during the wet season. Mouroucoa setosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
